comment.author: 22918055@N02
comment._content: William K. Vanderbilt purchased the entire block on Fifth Avenue (between 51st and 52nd Streets) in 1879.  He had architects John B. Snook and Charles Atwood design "twin houses" on the lot.  The Vanderbilt Twin Houses are shown on the left of the photo.

comment.author: 28296719@N04
comment._content: I like this photos because there doesn't seem to be a lot of junk in the photo... You know like advertising signs and the streets look clean and neat... No City looks like this anymore....
